subject: AI
title: Context Windows
description: The model's memory limit and what happens when you hit it.

hook.text: You paste a 200-page book into Claude and it summarizes beautifully. You try the same with GPT-3.5 and it chokes after 10 pages. The difference? Context window size.

buildup.text: The context window is the total number of tokens the model can process at once (input + output). GPT-4 Turbo: 128K. Claude 3: 200K. Llama 3: 8K‚Äì128K depending on version.

discovery.text: Bigger windows let you include more background, longer documents, and longer conversations without truncating. But they don't eliminate attention degradation in the middle.

twist.text: A 128K context window doesn't mean the model uses all 128K tokens equally well. Retrieval accuracy drops for information buried in the middle of very long contexts.

climax.text: Don't just check if your text fits the window ‚Äî check if the critical information is positioned where the model pays attention: the beginning and end.

punchline.text: The window tells you how much fits. Attention tells you how much gets used.

quiz.question: What is the context window of an LLM?
options: The screen size of the chat interface
The maximum tokens the model can process in one call (input + output)
The number of conversations the model remembers
